The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} while it remains immobilized in this way.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Ji-yook Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Jin-hae.name: Jin-hae
Jin-hae.allSavesBonus: -1 status penalty to all saves vs. death effects

weapon->Hook Sword.name: Hook Sword
weapon->Hook Sword.description: This long sword has a hook near the tip which makes it easy to snag an opponent or their weapons.

weapon->Feng Huo Lun.name: Feng Huo Lun
weapon->Feng Huo Lun.description: This large, flat steel ring features several protruding blades typically stylized to resemble flames.

action->Link Swords.name: Link Swords
action->Link Swords.description:
Requirements Jin-Hae is wielding two hook swords

Effect Jin-Hae either links her swords together or unlinks them. If the swords are linked, she can make linked hook sword Strikes; if the swords are unlinked, she can make hook sword Strikes.

action->-1 status penalty to all saves v.name: -1 status penalty to all saves vs. death effects

action->Susceptible to Death.name: Susceptible to Death
action->Susceptible to Death.description:
Though phantoms aren't alive, neither are they undead, and they are uniquely vulnerable to the effects of death.

A phantom whose Hit Points are reduced to 0 as a result of a death effect (such as from a spell like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Z9OrRXKgAPv6Hn5l]{Execute}) is immediately whisked away to the River of Souls, where their soul resumes the usual path to the afterlife.

action->Call a Battle Echo.name: Call a Battle Echo
action->Call a Battle Echo.description: Effect Jin-Hae pulls one of the battle echoes to her hand. She is fully aware of every echo and can always pull the one she wants, but she cannot call an echo that has already been unsealed.

action->Combined Charge.name: Combined Charge
action->Combined Charge.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Cloudsplitter Strides or Tramples within 5 feet of Jin-Hae

Effect Jin-Hae leaps onto Cloudsplitter's back as he charges. She can make a single melee attack against any target they pass during Cloudsplitter's movement.

action->Wind-Fire Charge.name: Wind-Fire Charge
action->Wind-Fire Charge.description:
Requirements Jin-Hae is wielding her feng huo lun

Effect Jin-Hae blasts off on her feng huo lun, leaving an elemental trail in her wake. She Strides up to twice her Speed and makes a feng huo lun Strike at any point during her movement. The path left by her movement is filled with her choice of an 8th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.it4ZsAi6XgvGcodc]{Wall of Wind} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IarZrgCeaiUqOuRu]{Wall of Fire} spell. Jin-Hae is unaffected by any walls she creates with this ability. She cannot use Wind-Fire Charge again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. If she uses Wind-Fire Charge again, the wall created by her previous Wind-Fire Charge disappears as soon as her action is completed.

action->Wind-Fire Chariot.name: Wind-Fire Chariot
action->Wind-Fire Chariot.description:
Requirements Jin-Hae is wielding two feng huo lun

Effect Jin-Hae's feng huo lun float by her feet, giving her the benefits of 7th- level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.U0hL0LLaprcnAyzC]{Migration}. While this lasts, she can wield her feng huo lun even while her hands are full by kicking with them, and her feng huo lun gain the thrown 20 feet trait as well as the effects of a returning rune.

action->Ceaseless Shadows.name: Ceaseless Shadows
action->Ceaseless Shadows.description: Juspix doesn't need concealment or cover to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. If he has lesser cover from creatures, he instead has cover and can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover}. If he has cover from creatures, he instead has greater cover.

action->Familiar.name: Familiar
action->Familiar.description: Juspix's familiar is a wildcat named Ontiok. Ontiok has a Speed of 40 feet, darkvision, and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.K5OLRDsGCfPZ6mO6]{Damage Avoidance: Reflex} familiar ability. Juspix has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.deC1yIM2S5szGdzT]{Lifelink} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.wOgvBymJOVQDSm1Q]{Spell Delivery} master abilities.

action->Site Bound.name: Site Bound
action->Site Bound.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
Burying Kannitri's remains in the courtyard or carving her name into the pagoda sculpture there (area A3) permanently puts her spirit to rest.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Corrupting Gaze.name: Corrupting Gaze
action->Corrupting Gaze.description:
The ghost stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes @Damage[7d6[void]] damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:33]{basic Will} save.

A creature that fails its save is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

action->Draining Touch.name: Draining Touch
action->Draining Touch.description:
With a touch, the ghost attempts to drain a living creature's life force. It makes a ghostly hand Strike but deals no damage on a hit.

Instead, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} for 1 day, and the ghost regains [[/r (max(1,floor(@actor.level/2)))[healing]]]{HP equal to half its own level}.

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
action->Flurry of Blows.description: Kannitri makes two Strikes with her ghostly fist. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Kas Xi Rai.name: Kas Xi Rai
Kas Xi Rai.acDetails: (42 vs. reactions and ranged weapon attacks)

equipment->Bracers of Armor II.name: Bracers of Armor II
equipment->Bracers of Armor II.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +2 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

consumable->Potion of Undetectability.name: Potion of Undetectability
consumable->Potion of Undetectability.description:
Drinking this dull-black liquid makes you undetectable to divinations.

This grants the same effects as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.C2w3YfBKjIRS07DP]{Hidden Mind}, but without the bonus against mental effects. You also gain the effects of a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell, which protects against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jwK43yKsHTkJQvQ9]{See the Unseen} spells of 8th level and lower and has a DC of 36 against @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]{Truesight}.

The potion's effects last for 10 minutes.

action->AC 42 vs. Reactions and Ranged W.name: AC 42 vs. Reactions and Ranged Weapon Attacks

action->Tangled Forest Trip.name: Tangled Forest Trip
action->Tangled Forest Trip.description:
Requirements Kas Xi Rai is in tangled forest stance

Trigger A creature leaves a space within Kas Xi Rai's reach

Effect The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:37] save, @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:37] check, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:37] check. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for that action.

action->Exhausting Flurry.name: Exhausting Flurry
action->Exhausting Flurry.description: When Kas Xi Rai targets the same creature with two Strikes from her Flurry of Blows and at least one hits and deals damage, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and take a -5-foot status penalty to land Speed while enfeebled. On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and takes a -10-foot status penalty to land Speed while enfeebled.

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
action->Flurry of Blows.description: Kas Xi Rai makes two Strikes with her fist. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

action->Tangled Forest Rake.name: Tangled Forest Rake
action->Tangled Forest Rake.description: Kas Xi Rai makes a lashing branch Strike. If she hits and deals damage, she forces the target to move 5 feet into a space within her reach.

action->Tangled Forest Stance.name: Tangled Forest Stance
action->Tangled Forest Stance.description: Kas Xi Rai extends her arms and enters a deadly tree-like combat stance. As long as she is in this stance, Kas Xi Rai can use Tangled Forest Trip and Tangled Forest Rake and make lashing branch Strikes with her fists.

weapon->Bo Staff.name: Bo Staff
weapon->Bo Staff.description: This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

weapon->Dart.name: Dart
weapon->Dart.description: This thrown weapon is larger than an arrow but shorter than a javelin. It typically has a short shaft of wood ending in a metal tip and is sometimes stabilized by feathers or fur.

equipment->Bracers of Armor I.name: Bracers of Armor I
equipment->Bracers of Armor I.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +1 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
action->Flurry of Blows.description: The ki adept makes two Strikes with his fist or with a monk weapon. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

action->Knocking Sweep.name: Knocking Sweep
action->Knocking Sweep.description: The ki adept swings their weapon with a sweeping spin. They attempt separate Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} any number of creatures within their reach. Each attempt counts toward the ki adept's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after they makes all the attacks.

action->Powerful Fists.name: Powerful Fists
action->Powerful Fists.description: The ki adept's fist Strikes are treated as cold iron and silver and don't take penalties when making lethal attacks.

action->Punch Down.name: Punch Down
action->Punch Down.description: The ki adept deals an extra 2d10 damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creatures.

weapon->Bo Staff.name: Bo Staff
weapon->Bo Staff.description: This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

weapon->Dart.name: Dart
weapon->Dart.description: This thrown weapon is larger than an arrow but shorter than a javelin. It typically has a short shaft of wood ending in a metal tip and is sometimes stabilized by feathers or fur.

equipment->Bracers of Armor I.name: Bracers of Armor I
equipment->Bracers of Armor I.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +1 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

action->Channel Element.name: Channel Element
action->Channel Element.description: Manyala and Rijana can draw upon the power in their bodies to temporarily channel energy. The next unarmed attack that they make deals 1d8 additional damage. This damage type is fire for Manyala and cold for Rijana.

action->Entwined Energy Ki.name: Entwined Energy Ki
action->Entwined Energy Ki.description: Manyala and Rijana can infuse energy into their ki blasts, allowing them to change the damage the spell deals. Manyala can choose to deal fire damage instead of force damage and Rijana can choose to deal cold damage instead of force damage.

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
action->Flurry of Blows.description: The ki adept makes two Strikes with his fist or with a monk weapon. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

action->Knocking Sweep.name: Knocking Sweep
action->Knocking Sweep.description: The ki adept swings their weapon with a sweeping spin. They attempt separate Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} any number of creatures within their reach. Each attempt counts toward the ki adept's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after they makes all the attacks.

action->Powerful Fists.name: Powerful Fists
action->Powerful Fists.description: The ki adept's fist Strikes are treated as cold iron and silver and don't take penalties when making lethal attacks.

action->Punch Down.name: Punch Down
action->Punch Down.description: The ki adept deals an extra 2d10 damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} creatures.

Koto Zekora.name: Koto Zekora
Koto Zekora.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

weapon->Greatclub.name: Greatclub
weapon->Greatclub.description: While many greatclubs are intricately carved, others are little more than a sturdy tree branch. These massive clubs are too heavy to wield with only one hand.

action->Bloodline Magic.name: Bloodline Magic
action->Bloodline Magic.description:
When Koto Zekora casts a bloodline spell, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8]{Translocate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ek5XI0aEdZhBgm21]{Scouting Eye}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Oj1PJBMQD9vuwCv7]{Quandary}, she gains a +1 status bonus to skill checks for 1 round.
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.tvybMInVm415jA3p]{Effect: Bloodline Magic}

action->+1 status to all saves vs. magic.name: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
Koto Zekora takes on the appearance of an ogre. This doesn't change her Speed or Strike attack and damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Kun.name: Kun
Kun.publicNotes: Hungry and resentful, the malevolent kun is a mythological fish monster that dwells in the remotest, coldest depths of the ocean. This massively powerful creatures could easily rule a subaquatic domain if they cared to, but kuns are also famous for their total self-absorption and complete ambivalence toward other forms of life. A kun remains as far away from other creatures as they can, subsisting on only their own icy hatred. They can consume and digest prey, but such feedings are incidental. Most kuns remain ignorant and uncaring, keeping themselves in the dark, disregarding any signs of life around them except to occasionally lash out with a spiteful attack.

action->Spite.name: Spite
action->Spite.description:
Trigger A creature within reach of the kun's tail uses an action to attack or heal another creature (including the kun)

Effect The kun bats the triggering creature away with their tail, making a tail Strike against the creature. On a hit, the action is disrupted and the creature is pushed 10 feet.

action->Funnel.name: Funnel
action->Funnel.description:
The kun inhales violently, sucking in heat and all creatures in the water in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60]. Creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[10d8[cold]] damage. The kun can't Funnel again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Funnel]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is pulled 30 feet toward the kun.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is pulled 60 feet toward the kun.

action->Heart of Darkness.name: Heart of Darkness
action->Heart of Darkness.description: Whenever the kun makes an attack from within an area of darkness, their attack deals an additional 2d6 spirit damage.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

equipment->Bracers of Armor II.name: Bracers of Armor II
equipment->Bracers of Armor II.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +2 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

equipment->Wooden Harrow Deck.name: Wooden Harrow Deck
equipment->Wooden Harrow Deck.description:
Used by gamblers and seers alike, this deck of cards comes in several varieties.

Common harrow decks are made from higher-quality paper and feature illustrations-harrow readers typically use these decks.

action->Control Harrow Cards.name: Control Harrow Cards
action->Control Harrow Cards.description: Lantondo can Strike with any of their harrow cards as long as they can see their target. When Lantondo Strikes with a harrow card, they can leave the card on any surface in the target's space or return the card to their deck at the end of the action.

weapon->Fighting Fan.name: Fighting Fan
weapon->Fighting Fan.description: This fan is useful for elegant dances as well as for slicing unsuspecting foes with the blades along its outer edge. If used in performances, it might be disguised as a frilly accessory, or it might be an obvious, though elegant, weapon.

equipment->Maestro's Instrument (Greater.name: Maestro's Instrument (Greater)
equipment->Maestro's Instrument (Greater.description:
A maestro's instrument can be crafted in the form of any variety of handheld musical instrument. A greater maestro's instrument grants you a +3 item bonus to Performance checks while playing music with the instrument.

Activate D Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You can play the instrument to produce the effects of an 8th level (DC 38) @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.

Craft Requirements You must supply a casting of charm of the appropriate rank.

action->Call Dancers.name: Call Dancers
action->Call Dancers.description: Laruhao sends out a pulse of inviting melody that calls more yokai from the ether, restoring 30 Hit Points to the dancing night parade.

action->Master of Barriers.name: Master of Barriers
action->Master of Barriers.description: Laruhao wishes for nothing more than to dance atop his yagura, undisturbed. When he uses his house of imaginary walls composition spell, he creates four 10-foot-by-10-foot walls in a cube around him. A creature must succeed at a DC 41 counteract check to teleport within these walls; otherwise, the teleportation attempt fails.

action->Dance, Puppets, Dance!.name: Dance, Puppets, Dance!
action->Dance, Puppets, Dance!.description: Laruhao plays an invigorating melody that signals his horde to attack. The dancing night parade can use either Seiya! Soiya! or the two-action version of Wasshoi! Wasshoi! as a reaction.

Lophiithu.name: Lophiithu
Lophiithu.publicNotes: Lophiithus dwell in the deepest ocean trenches, places untouched by light, hope, or mortal comprehension. They appear to be gaping maws with distended jaws, vestigial flaps of putrefying flesh, and filamentous tentacles tipped with glowing light. Their extraplanar mouths take up most of their bodies, leaving no room for other organs, and any prey they swallow is transported to the Maelstrom for digestion.

action->Beguiling Lure.name: Beguiling Lure
action->Beguiling Lure.description: A creature hit by a lophiithu's lure must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:41|traits:illusion,mental,occult,visual] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the lophiithu's lures for 1 minute. On a critical failure, it can't use reactions while it remains fascinated. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 hour.

action->Dimensional Swallow.name: Dimensional Swallow
action->Dimensional Swallow.description: The lophiithu's digestive organs exist in the Maelstrom, regardless of the location of their external form. The lophiithu can swallow any number of creatures of any size. Creatures that Escape the lophiithu's stomach do so normally. Creatures that cut themselves free instead find themselves in the Maelstrom near nothing but one of the lophiithu's disembodied stomachs. When the lophiithu dies, their stomach becomes a rift connecting to their mouth, allowing a creature to return to their plane. This rift disappears after 1 minute.

action->Lure Whip.name: Lure Whip
action->Lure Whip.description: The lophiithu makes a lure Strike against each creature within reach. These attacks count toward the lophiithu's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after these attacks.

weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Greater).name: Alchemist's Fire (Greater)
weapon->Alchemist's Fire (Greater).description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 3d8 fire damage, 3 persistent fire damage, and 3 fire splash damage. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.

shield->Sturdy Shield (Greater).name: Sturdy Shield (Greater)
shield->Sturdy Shield (Greater).description:
With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

The shield has Hardness 15, HP 120, and BT 60.

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: The battle dancer Interacts to draw a weapon and Strikes with it.

action->Shield Drum.name: Shield Drum
action->Shield Drum.description: The battle dancer Raises a Shield, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralizes}.

action->Threatening Dance.name: Threatening Dance
action->Threatening Dance.description:
The battle dancer either Steps and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EEDElIyin4z60PXx]{Performs} , or Performs and then Steps. Compare the Performance result to the Will DC of one creature in the battle dancer's reach.

Critical Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all attacks until the start of the battle dancer's next turn.

Success The creature is off-guard to the next attack by a creature other than the battle dancer before the start of the battle dancer's next turn.

action->Brilliant Wordplay.name: Brilliant Wordplay
action->Brilliant Wordplay.description:
Trigger Mafika is the target of a linguistic effect

Effect Mafika attempts to counteract the effect (counteract modifier +30). If he counteracts the effect, he can use that effect on a new target of his choice within 30 feet.

action->Tempest-Sun Shielding.name: Tempest-Sun Shielding
action->Tempest-Sun Shielding.description:
Mafika transforms unrealized spell energy into a protective shield

Trigger Mafika or an ally within 30 feet takes damage

Effect Mafika expends a prepared spell in a spell slot. He reduces the triggering damage by four times the spell slot's level.

action->Halcyon Surge.name: Halcyon Surge
action->Halcyon Surge.description: Mafika casts an arcane spell that takes 2 actions or fewer to Cast, then casts a druid order spell that takes 2 actions or fewer to Cast (paying 1 Focus Point, as normal).

action->Shift Spell.name: Shift Spell
action->Shift Spell.description:
Requirements Mafika has an area spell active with a remaining duration and he is within the spell's range

Effect Mafika moves the spell's area to a new point of origin. The spell's remaining duration is reduced by half. Instantaneous or permanent effects of the spell (such as damage or healing) are unaffected and aren't repeated.

weapon->Longsword.name: Longsword
weapon->Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

equipment->Bracers of Armor I.name: Bracers of Armor I
equipment->Bracers of Armor I.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +1 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

action->Spell Punch.name: Spell Punch
action->Spell Punch.description:
Trigger The mage of many styles begins to Cast a Spell that targets at least 1 creature

Effect The mage channels the spell through their fist. The mage makes a fist Strike against a target within reach. If the Strike is successful, the target is subjected to the spell. If the spell required an attack roll, the target is hit automatically upon a successful Strike. If the spell required a saving throw, the target takes a -2 status penalty to its saving throw. If the spell could target multiple creatures, it targets only the creature the mage hit with their fist Strike.

Mammoth Turtle.name: Mammoth Turtle
Mammoth Turtle.publicNotes: If the regular-sized snapping turtle is foul-tempered, then the giant snapping turtle seems to be willfully violent toward anything that dares intrude upon its domain. Measuring over 20 feet long and weighing thousands of pounds, this creature is capable of swallowing a humanoid whole. Swamp-dwelling societies, particularly boggards and lizardfolk, have often tried to domesticate giant snapping turtles to serve as powerful guardians, but in most cases the casualties pile up quickly. Those unfortunate enough to be swallowed whole by a giant snapping turtle find that even the creature's stomach is somewhat armored, making it difficult to cut through.

action->Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
action->Deep Breath.description: The mammoth turtle can hold its breath for 4 hours.

action->Fling.name: Fling
action->Fling.description:
Requirements The turtle has a creature grabbed in its jaws

Effect The turtle flings the creature into the air from its mouth, sending it up to 10 feet up and 20 feet away. The creature falls 25 feet (assuming the turtle flings it as high as it can) and takes the appropriate amount of bludgeoning damage from the fall. (@Damage[12[bludgeoning]]{12 bludgeoning})

action->Shell Defense.name: Shell Defense
action->Shell Defense.description: The mammoth turtle retracts its limbs and head into its shell and ends its turn. This increases its AC to 38, but it can't act except to reemerge, which it can do as a single action.

action->Capsize.name: Capsize
action->Capsize.description: The turtle tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. The turtle must succeed at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:43] check (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the turtle) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Manananggal.name: Manananggal
Manananggal.publicNotes:
Manananggals are wicked monsters that live as humanoids during the day but feed upon them at night. To hide their depravities, these beings disguise themselves as everyday people-typically recluses or eccentrics- and use their proximity to a community to pick out their next targets before striking under cover of night. Manananggals use their long, hollow tongues to drain victims' blood from vital organs such as the liver, and the resulting odd drainage marks make it difficult to determine the exact nature of a victim's death. This typically leads to confusion, terror, and mistrust among communities, which most manananggals savor. While they fly, manananggals make a distinctive ticking sound, leading some to refer to the creatures as "tik-tiks," and badly affected communities descend into fearful chaos at the first reports of this telltale noise.

Manananggals share their cannibalistic, body-separating traits with other types of tanngals, such as penanggalans, though a number of characteristics set them apart. For instance, whereas penanggalans relish vinegar and even bathe in the substance, manananggals abhor the merest scent of it.
Manananggal.speedsDetails: fly only when body is separated

action->Separated Body.name: Separated Body
action->Separated Body.description:
A manananggal typically resembles a living humanoid. It doesn't appear as an aberration at first glance and receives a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC when Impersonating a humanoid. At any time but especially at night, a manananggal can, as a three-action activity with the manipulate trait, rip its upper torso from its bottom half, leaving the lower torso limp and helpless but allowing the upper torso to fly free. A manananggal can separate its body at any time, but it risks further damage if it does so during the day.

The manananggal's upper and lower halves share the same pool of HP. If its lower half is damaged, the manananggal is immediately aware of the attack. Each minute a manananggal remains separated after sunrise and before sunset, it takes [[/r 2d6]] points of damage until it reattaches its upper and lower torsos or is destroyed, whichever comes first.

action->Blood Drain.name: Blood Drain
action->Blood Drain.description:
Requirements The manananggal has a creature grabbed.

Effect The manananggal drives its tongue into the grabbed creature to drink its blood. This deals [[/r 4d6]] damage, and the manananggal gains temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. A creature whose blood is drained by a manananggal is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} until it receives healing (of any kind or amount).

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

action->Lasting Debilitating Strike.name: Lasting Debilitating Strike
action->Lasting Debilitating Strike.description:
Trigger The xun's Strike hits an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creature and deals damage

Effect The xun applies one of the following debilitations, which lasts until the end of the xun's next turn or for 1 week on a critical hit.

Debilitation The target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

Debilitation The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The master xun deals an extra 3d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} opponents.

Melodic Squall.name: Melodic Squall
Melodic Squall.publicNotes: This cloud of song and sound has been caught by the wind and carried across the air. While the melody on the wind might enjoy the beauty of music, it is by nature a destructive elemental force.

action->Hostile Duet.name: Hostile Duet
action->Hostile Duet.description:
Trigger A hostile creature within 30 feet creates an effect with the auditory trait that provides bonuses to itself or its allies

Effect The melodic squall recreates the auditory effect, gaining the bonuses for itself and its allies as long as the original effect persists.

action->Retune.name: Retune
action->Retune.description:
Trigger The melodic squall is targeted by a spell with the auditory trait

Effect The melodic squall attempts to counteract the spell. If it succeeds, the spell effect is caught in a blast of wind that sweeps it back to its origin, affecting the caster. Targets of the triggering effect other than the melody on the wind are still affected normally.

action->Mesmerizing Melody.name: Mesmerizing Melody
action->Mesmerizing Melody.description:
The melodic squall sings in a sonorous chorus. Any creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:36] save to resist becoming fascinated by the melody on the wind. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is fascinated for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Subsonic Burst.name: Subsonic Burst
action->Subsonic Burst.description:
The melodic squall focuses intense sound at an inaudible frequency in a @Template[type:line|distance:100]. Each creature in the line must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} until the beginning of the melodic squall's next turn.

action->Swiftness.name: Swiftness
action->Swiftness.description: The melodic squall's movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Mogaru's Breath.name: Mogaru's Breath
Mogaru's Breath.descriptionHazard: Mogaru exhales a blast of intense flames to eradicate any meddlesome pests in the area.
Mogaru's Breath.disable: @Check[type:performance|dc:50|name:Divert Mogaru's Attention] (legendary) or @Check[type:deception|dc:53|name:Divert Mogaru's Attention] (legendary) to momentarily divert Mogaru's attention
Mogaru's Breath.reset: Mogaru must wait [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} before letting loose another gout of fire.

action->Volcanic Breath.name: Volcanic Breath
action->Volcanic Breath.description:
Trigger A creature takes a hostile action against Mogaru, produces a visible area effect, or flies within 120 feet of Mogaru

Effect Mogaru breathes a @Template[type:cone|distance:120] of fire toward the object of his ire. Flammable objects in the area immediately combust, and stone or metal surfaces warp into difficult terrain. Creatures in the area take @Damage[20d6[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:44|basic:true] save). On a failed or critically failed save, a creature also takes @Damage[3d6[persistent,fire]] damage.

Muckish Creep.name: Muckish Creep
Muckish Creep.publicNotes:
Legends say that the first muckish creeps were born at the site of a mass grave where the souls of murdered prisoners coalesced into the surrounding soil. Another myth tells that muckish creeps were elementals so vile that their kin banished them from the Plane of Earth. Regardless of their true origins, muckish creeps are wicked creatures that resemble mud given a humanoid shape. The mud is no ordinary mixture of earth and water, however, for muckish creeps feed on the blood of the living, and they use this blood to keep their own forms moist and malleable.

Muckish creeps are particularly tenacious and single-minded when it comes to choosing prey. Once a muckish creep selects its next victim, there is little one can do to stop it, since it can seep through even the smallest cracks between doors, walls, and windows. A muckish creep typically waits until its target falls asleep before pressing itself into the creature's home, intent to kill. For all its tenacity during the hunt, the muckish creep is pragmatic when it comes to the actual kill, using its body to fill the victim's airways with mud and suffocate them.

action->Compression.name: Compression
action->Compression.description: A muckish creep can move through a gap at least 6 inches wide without Squeezing and can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} through any gap at least 1 inch wide.

action->Mud Trail.name: Mud Trail
action->Mud Trail.description: When a muckish creep Strides or Steps, it leaves behind a slimy mud trail that coats the traversed area. All traversed squares are covered in @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:26] or @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:26|name:Mud Trails]) until the start of the muckish creep's next turn.

action->Slippery Body.name: Slippery Body
action->Slippery Body.description: A muckish creep's body allows it to slip away from most restraints. It gains a +4 status bonus to checks to Escape. On a success, it gets a critical success instead. On a critical failure, it gets a failure instead.

action->Elude Grasp.name: Elude Grasp
action->Elude Grasp.description:
Trigger A creature succeeds at an attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the muckish creep.

Effect The muckish creep attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

action->Blinding Mud.name: Blinding Mud
action->Blinding Mud.description: When a muckish creep hits a creature with a mud ball Strike, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} on a critical hit). The creature can use an Interact action to wipe away the mud and remove the dazzled or blinded condition.

action->Overwhelm.name: Overwhelm
action->Overwhelm.description:
Requirements The muckish creep has a creature grabbed.

Effect The muckish creep fills the grabbed creature's mouth and nose with mud. The creature begins to suffocate unless it succeeds at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23] save. The suffocating creature or any adjacent creatures can clear the suffocating creature's airway with an Interact action.

equipment->Hat of Disguise (Greater).name: Hat of Disguise (Greater)
equipment->Hat of Disguise (Greater).description:
This ordinary-looking hat allows you to cloak yourself in illusions.

Activate D Interact

Frequency any number of times per day

Effect The hat casts a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise} spell on you. While setting up the disguise, you can magically alter the hat to appear as a comb, ribbon, helm, or other piece of headwear.

action->Quick Change.name: Quick Change
action->Quick Change.description: Nai Yan Fei adopts a mundane disguise, appearing as a nondescript human with a neutral alignment and a mundane occupation such as common laborer, farmer, or peasant. She can return to her typical persona as empress at any time by using Quick Change again.

action->Debilitating Strike.name: Debilitating Strike
action->Debilitating Strike.description:
Trigger Nai Yan Fei hits an off-guard creature and deals damage.

Effect Nai Yan Fei applies one of the following debilitations, which lasts until the end of her next turn.

• Debilitation The target takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speeds.

• Debilitation The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

• Debilitation The target can't flank other creatures, and it can't provide flanking for its allies.

•Debilitation The target doesn't gain a circumstance bonus to AC from Raising a Shield, lesser cover, or standard cover; it gains only a +2 circumstance bonus to AC from greater cover or Taking Cover.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.yBTASi3FvnReAwHy]{Effect: Debilitating Strike}

action->Master Strike.name: Master Strike
action->Master Strike.description:
Trigger Nai Yan Fei hits an off-guard creature and deals damage.

Effect The target attempts a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:39] save. It then becomes immune to Nai Yan Fei's Master Strike for 1 day.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} until the end of Nai Yan Fei's next turn.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 4 rounds.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 4 rounds, knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} for 2 hours, or killed (Nai Yan Fei's choice).

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Nai Yan Fei's Strikes deal an additional 4d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Divine Destruction.name: Divine Destruction
action->Divine Destruction.description:
When the divine warden is reduced to 0 HP, it erupts with divine energy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30], dealing @Damage[14d6[vitality]] damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:32] save with the following outcomes.

Critical Success The creature takes half damage.

Success The creature takes full damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes temporarily cursed by the patron deity. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 day; this is a curse effect that uses the Will save DC as the counteract DC.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

action->Faith Bound.name: Faith Bound
action->Faith Bound.description: A divine warden can't attack a creature that openly wears or displays the religious symbol of the divine warden's patron deity unless that creature uses a hostile action against the divine warden first. If the divine warden is intelligent, it can also attack a creature it believes isn't faithful to its deity or who wears the religious symbol as a ruse (typically after succeeding at a Perception check to Sense Motive).

action->Faithful Weapon.name: Faithful Weapon
action->Faithful Weapon.description: A divine warden always wields its patron deity's favored weapon. If the weapon is a ranged weapon, the divine warden automatically generates new ammunition with each attack. For a divine warden of 4th level or higher, the deity's favored weapon gains the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} rune while the divine warden wields it; at 12th level, these effects are of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.KCQRFvUgbyclvOGi]{Greater Striking} rune, and at 19th level, they're instead of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.woxl2FrrgAcJDu0t]{Major Striking} rune.

action->Instrument of Faith.name: Instrument of Faith
action->Instrument of Faith.description: The divine warden is a beacon for its deity's faith. A cleric of the divine warden's patron deity can channel a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell through a divine warden they can see within 60 feet. The cleric determines any targets or area for the spell as if they were standing in the divine warden's space.

Orochi.name: Orochi
Orochi.publicNotes: An orochi is an enormous serpent with eight heads and eight tails that lives among large waterways. Orochi are vile, amoral creatures kept at bay only with yearly sacrifices. Most settlements unable to satisfy an orochi with a sacrifice soon meet their destruction.

action->Multiple Heads.name: Multiple Heads
action->Multiple Heads.description: A creature can attempt to sever one of the orochi's eight heads by specifically targeting it and dealing damage equal to the head's HP. A head not completely severed returns to full HP at the end of the attacking creature's turn. An orochi that loses all of their heads immediately dies.

action->Head: Weaknesses and Immunities.name: Head: Weaknesses and Immunities
action->Head: Weaknesses and Immunities.description:
HP 60, multiple heads

Immunities area damage

Weaknesses cold iron 15

Resistances poison 15

action->Multiple Opportunities.name: Multiple Opportunities
action->Multiple Opportunities.description: The orochi gains an extra reaction per round for each of their heads that remains beyond the first, which it can use only to make Attacks of Opportunity. They can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, and the orochi must use a different head for each Attack of Opportunity.

action->Orochi Flurry.name: Orochi Flurry
action->Orochi Flurry.description: The orochi makes a number of jaws Strikes equal to the number of their remaining heads, each against a different target. The orochi's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after the orochi makes all of their attacks.

Peng.name: Peng
Peng.publicNotes:
Pengs are massive avian beasts who fly effortlessly among the highest clouds. Their bright plumage makes it difficult to see their shape against an azure sky, but with patience, an onlooker might notice movement too swift to be a natural cloud.

Beautiful and graceful, pengs arise from the unlikeliest of origins: the cruel kun, a hateful fish monster whose predilection for the crushing depths of the sea matches the peng's own love of the bright, open sky. After a kun sacrifices their power for a noble heart by bathing in the sun's rays, they transform into this majestic bird, which eschews violence unless they must fight to stay free. Pengs do not seek danger or thrills; they want only to make their long voyages and fly without disruption.

A peng's calm and steady nature is so strong that its mere presence can quell storms and still winds. Mariners and pilots believe spotting a peng is a sign of good luck. When the sky is clear and blue and the weather gentle for an extended period, people attribute such fine conditions to the presence of an unseen peng.

action->Calm Weather Aura.name: Calm Weather Aura
action->Calm Weather Aura.description: 1 mile. The ambient weather around a peng is always lightly cloudy with a pleasant breeze, and the temperature is pleasantly warm for the season. A creature that attempts to alter the weather within this aura (such as with a control weather ritual or localized effect like gust of wind) must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:33] save; otherwise the effect is disrupted. The peng can activate or deactivate this aura as a single action (this action has the concentrate trait).

action->Windslice.name: Windslice
action->Windslice.description: Pengs can move in any wind with easy grace. A peng ignores difficult terrain caused by wind and doesn't need to Maneuver in Flight in high winds.

action->Cloud Cover.name: Cloud Cover
action->Cloud Cover.description: The peng exhales a thick cloud and envelops themself in the mist. The peng gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Cover} until the end of their next turn.

action->Flap Wings.name: Flap Wings
action->Flap Wings.description: The peng beats its wings to create a mighty burst of frosty air and push away foes. Each creature within 10 feet of the peng takes @Damage[3d6[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[3d6[cold]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true] save). Creatures that fail their save are pushed away 10 feet; creatures that critically fail are pushed away 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The peng can't Flap Wings again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Flap Wings]]{1d4 rounds}.

Planar Terra-cotta Soldier.name: Planar Terra-cotta Soldier
Planar Terra-cotta Soldier.publicNotes:
Terra-cotta warriors guard the tombs of ancient rulers, where they stand vigil, animating only when intruders break in to pilfer riches or defile the tomb itself. Each warrior is meticulously crafted from clay and given unique features.

A single terra-cotta warrior stands 6 feet tall and weighs 600 pounds.

weapon->Longsword.name: Longsword
weapon->Longsword.description: Longswords can be one-edged or two-edged swords. Their blades are heavy and they're between 3 and 4 feet in length.

shield->Steel Shield.name: Steel Shield
shield->Steel Shield.description:
Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

Hardness HP BT
5 20 10

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Planar Step.name: Planar Step
action->Planar Step.description: The planar terra-cotta soldier momentarily moves beneath the Material Plane, instantly transporting itself to a location within 60 feet. The soldier can't use Planar Step again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Planar Step]]{1d4 rounds}

Planar Terra-cotta Squadron.name: Planar Terra-cotta Squadron
Planar Terra-cotta Squadron.publicNotes:
Terra-cotta warriors guard the tombs of ancient rulers, where they stand vigil, animating only when intruders break in to pilfer riches or defile the tomb itself. Each warrior is meticulously crafted from clay and given unique features.

These constructed warriors can work together as a trained group to repel intruders.

shield->Steel Shield.name: Steel Shield
shield->Steel Shield.description:
Like wooden shields, steel shields come in a variety of shapes and sizes. Though more expensive than wooden shields, they are much more durable.

Hardness HP BT
5 20 10

action->Planar Step.name: Planar Step
action->Planar Step.description: The planar terra-cotta squadron momentarily moves beneath the Material Plane, instantly transporting itself to a location within 90 feet. The squadron can't use Planar Step again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Planar Step]]{1d4 rounds}

action->Aim as One.name: Aim as One
action->Aim as One.description: The troop launches a ranged attack in the form of a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 100 feet that deals [[/r 3d8+13]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:33|basic:true] save). When the garrison is reduced to 8 or fewer squares, this area decreases to a @Template[type:burst|distance:5].

action->Raise Shields.name: Raise Shields
action->Raise Shields.description: The troop raises steel shields, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise a Shield}.

action->Strike as One.name: Strike as One
action->Strike as One.description:
A to T

Frequency once per round

Effect The garrison makes a melee attack against each enemy within 5 feet (@Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

A @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage.

D @Damage[(3d8+13)[slashing]] damage.

T @Damage[(4d8+16)[slashing]] damage.

action->Troop Movement.name: Troop Movement
action->Troop Movement.description: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

Portal Eater.name: Portal Eater
Portal Eater.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Eat Portal.name: Eat Portal
action->Eat Portal.description:
Requirements The portal eater's beak is not grabbing a creature

Trigger A creature teleports or is summoned within 50 feet of the portal eater

Effect The portal eater attempts to eat the portal. It makes a counteract check against the effect (counteract modifier +33, counteract rank 9th). If the effect is counteracted, the creature arrives in the portal eater's beak and the portal eater @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grabs} it.

action->Enormous.name: Enormous
action->Enormous.description: A portal eater is a massive creature and takes up a space of 10 squares by 10 squares (50 feet by 50 feet).

action->+1 status to all saves vs. magic.name: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Reflect Spell.name: Reflect Spell
action->Reflect Spell.description:
Trigger A creature Casts a Spell that targets the portal eater

Effect The portal eater attempts to counteract the spell (counteract modifier +32, counteract rank 9th). If the spell is counteracted, it targets the caster instead.

action->Unfurl Realities.name: Unfurl Realities
action->Unfurl Realities.description: The portal eater unfurls its crystalline cloak of stolen realities, releasing a wave of cosmic energy and casting @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray} (DC 39) in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]. The portal eater can't Unfurl Realities again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Unfurl Realities]]{1d4 rounds}.

Quaking Footfall.name: Quaking Footfall
Quaking Footfall.descriptionHazard: Mogaru's steady footsteps pick up speed, causing the earth around him to tremble as though from a powerful earthquake.
Quaking Footfall.disable: three @Check[type:athletics|dc:39|name:Brace a Small Structure or Surface] (trained), @Check[type:crafting|dc:39|name:Brace a Small Structure or Surface] (trained), or @Check[type:engineering|dc:39|name:Brace a Small Structure or Surface]{Engineering Lore} (trained) checks to brace a small structure or surface to cancel the effects of the quake in that area; @Check[type:performance|dc:41|name:Calm Mogaru] (legendary) to calm Mogaru momentarily
Quaking Footfall.reset: Mogaru doesn't rush this way again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Quake.name: Quake
action->Quake.description:
Trigger Mogaru moves at least 60 feet

Effect The ground shakes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:120] from Mogaru's space. This creates a variety of effects, depending on where the player characters are at the time of the quake.

In most parts of the city, the ground becomes difficult terrain, and creatures on it are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 round.

In parts of the city with existing underground spaces (like sewers, sinkholes, or catacombs), fissures open up in the ground. Creatures in the area tumble into the resulting 40-foot-deep hole unless they succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:40] save.

In bays, on beaches, and in other relatively substantial but shallow bodies of water, Mogaru's movement creates dangerous waves. Creatures in the water or within 60 feet of the waterline are struck by waves that deal @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:35|basic:true] save). On a critically failed save, a creature is instantly swept 60 feet out to sea and 60 feet under the water's surface.

Rai Sho Disciple.name: Rai Sho Disciple
Rai Sho Disciple.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

action->Crying Bell Stance.name: Crying Bell Stance
action->Crying Bell Stance.description: The disciple cups one hand and poses the other to strike it, like the Rai Sho Monastery's central bell. In this stance, they can make temple bell Strikes (see Strikes). While in this stance, a disciple gains a +2 status bonus to AC against ranged attacks.

action->Falling Sal Stance.name: Falling Sal Stance
action->Falling Sal Stance.description: The disciple joins their palms together in the shape of a sal flower, evoking the truth that all things eventually decay. In this stance, they can make sal blossom Strikes (see Strikes) and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}, and can use the extra action only to cast wholeness of body.

action->+1 status to all saves vs. menta.name: +1 status to all saves vs. mental

action->Nine Seals Spellcasting.name: Nine Seals Spellcasting
action->Nine Seals Spellcasting.description: The Rai Sho disciples have learned a technique that allows them to cast their ki spells more effectively by way of specialized hand postures. They replace the normal somatic and verbal components of their spells with nine seals components; these require that the caster have a hand free, but don't add any traits to the Cast a Spell action (preventing the Rai Sho disciples from triggering certain reactions, such as Attack of Opportunity, when they Cast a Spell).

action->Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
action->Flurry of Blows.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The Rai Sho disciple makes two Strikes, each of which must be an unarmed Strike or temple bell Strike. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

Rai Sho Postulant.name: Rai Sho Postulant
Rai Sho Postulant.allSavesBonus: +4 status to all saves vs. fear and dreams

action->+4 status to all saves vs. fear.name: +4 status to all saves vs. fear and dreams

action->Nightmare Guardian.name: Nightmare Guardian
action->Nightmare Guardian.description: rai sho postulants gain a +4 status bonus to saves against fear and against spells and abilities that affect dreams. A rai sho postulant that falls prey to a supernatural nightmare loses this ability and becomes permanently enraged, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack and damage status bonus to attack and damage rolls and a -1 status penalty to AC.

action->Nine Seals Spellcasting.name: Nine Seals Spellcasting
action->Nine Seals Spellcasting.description: The Rai Sho postulants have learned a technique that allows them to cast their ki spells more effectively by way of specialized hand postures. They replace the normal somatic and verbal components of their spells with nine seals components; these require that the caster have a hand free, but don't add any traits to the Cast a Spell action (preventing the Rai Sho postulants from triggering certain reactions, such as Attack of Opportunity, when they Cast a Spell).

action->Snowblind.name: Snowblind
action->Snowblind.description: When Hiding, the yeti is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by any snowfall, even if it's not thick enough to make other creatures concealed.

action->Vanish.name: Vanish
action->Vanish.description:
Trigger The rai sho postulant is hidden or undetected while not in combat, and a creature would observe it.

Effect The rai sho postulant Strides or Climbs up to half its Speed to a location where it can Hide, then Hides. If its new Stealth check result meets or exceeds the triggering creature's Perception DC, the yeti remains hidden.

action->Frozen Flurry.name: Frozen Flurry
action->Frozen Flurry.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The Rai Sho postulant makes two Strikes, which can be any combination of claw or icicle Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses. If either Strike hits and deals damage, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:37|traits:incapacitation] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure); this save has the incapacitation trait.

action->Grizzly Arrival.name: Grizzly Arrival
action->Grizzly Arrival.description:
Trigger The rai sho postulant hits a creature in the first round of combat and the rai sho postulant was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} from that creature at the start of combat.

Effect Each enemy within 30 feet that witnesses the attack (including the target of the attack) must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:37] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}; on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}.

weapon->Halfling Sling Staff.name: Halfling Sling Staff
weapon->Halfling Sling Staff.description: This staff ends in a Y-shaped split that cradles a sling. The length of the staff provides excellent leverage when used two-handed to fling rocks or bullets from the sling.

action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)
action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
When a creature triggers Ran-to's Attack of Opportunity, he can attempt an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the triggering creature instead of making a melee Strike. He can still disrupt a triggering manipulate action if he critically succeeds his attempt.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Body Slam.name: Body Slam
action->Body Slam.description:
Requirements Ran-to has a creature grabbed.

Effect Ran-to throws his foe against the ground. The grabbed creature takes @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]] damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The grapple ends.

action->Leaping Catch.name: Leaping Catch
action->Leaping Catch.description: Ran-to makes a mighty leap and attempts to Grab a foe while he soars. He makes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. His maximum distance is 40 feet. He must succeed at an Athletics check to perform the leap as usual, but regardless of the type of leap, the DC is equal to the number of feet he moves in the air. Ran-to can attempt an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} at any point during the jump. Immediately after the attempt, he (and the creature, if the Grapple was successful) falls to the ground. Neither creature takes damage from this fall.

action->Titan Wrestler.name: Titan Wrestler
action->Titan Wrestler.description: Ran-to can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} creatures up to two sizes larger than him.

action->Whirlwind Toss.name: Whirlwind Toss
action->Whirlwind Toss.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Ran-to has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect Ran-to spins the creature he's holding, smashing them against any creatures within his reach, and then throws the creature aside. Ran-to attempts an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success Ran-to tosses his foe a great distance. The grab ends. The grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 10 feet, takes @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. All creatures adjacent to Ran-to take the same amount of bludgeoning damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:34|basic:true] save).

Success As critical success, except the grabbed creatures is thrown into a space within 5 feet, and creatures take @Damage[6d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Failure Ran-to tosses his foe aside. The grab ends. The grabbed creature falls prone.

Critical Failure Ran-to loses hold of his foe, causing the grapple to end.

weapon->Gauntlet.name: Gauntlet
weapon->Gauntlet.description: A pair of these metal gloves comes with full plate, half plate, and splint armor; they can also be purchased separately and worn with other types of armor. They not only protect your hands but also transform your hands into lethal weapons.

weapon->Halfling Sling Staff.name: Halfling Sling Staff
weapon->Halfling Sling Staff.description: This staff ends in a Y-shaped split that cradles a sling. The length of the staff provides excellent leverage when used two-handed to fling rocks or bullets from the sling.

consumable->Explosive Ammunition (Greate.name: Explosive Ammunition (Greater)
consumable->Explosive Ammunition (Greate.description:
Activate A Interact

This piece of ammunition is coated in gritty black soot. When activated explosive ammunition hits a target, the missile explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10], dealing [[/r10d6]] fire damage to each creature in the area (including the target). Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true|name:Greater Explosive Ammunition] save.

consumable->Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
consumable->Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)
action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
When a creature triggers Ran-to's Attack of Opportunity, he can attempt an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the triggering creature instead of making a melee Strike. He can still disrupt a triggering manipulate action if he critically succeeds his attempt.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Body Slam.name: Body Slam
action->Body Slam.description:
Requirements Ran-to has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect Ran-to throws his foe to the ground. The grabbed creature takes @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:37|basic:true] save) and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The grab ends.

action->Greater Leaping Catch.name: Greater Leaping Catch
action->Greater Leaping Catch.description: Ran-to bounds up and attempts to Grab a foe while he soars. He makes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}. His maximum distance is 75 feet. He must succeed at an Athletics check to perform the leap as usual, but regardless of the type of leap the DC is equal to half the number of feet he moves in the air. Ran-to can attempt an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} at any point during the jump. Immediately after the attempt, he (and the creature, if the Grapple was successful) falls to the ground. Ran-to takes no falling damage when using this ability, but the grabbed creature takes the appropriate amount of falling damage as if they had fallen the distance moved.

action->Titan Wrestler.name: Titan Wrestler
action->Titan Wrestler.description: Ran-to can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} creatures up to two sizes larger than him.

action->Whirlwind Toss.name: Whirlwind Toss
action->Whirlwind Toss.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Ran-to has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect Ran-to spins the creature he's holding, smashing them against any creatures within his reach, and then throws the creature aside. Ran-to attempts an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success Ran-to tosses his foe a great distance. The grab ends. The grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 10 feet, takes @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. All creatures adjacent to Ran-to take the same amount of bludgeoning damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true] save).

Success As critical success, except the grabbed creatures is thrown into a space within 5 feet, and creatures take @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Failure Ran-to tosses his foe aside. The grab ends. The grabbed creature falls prone.

Critical Failure Ran-to loses hold of his foe, causing the grapple to end.

Ran-to (Level 20).name: Ran-to (Level 20)
Ran-to (Level 20).allSavesBonus: +3 status to all saves vs. evocation

weapon->Gauntlet.name: Gauntlet
weapon->Gauntlet.description: A pair of these metal gloves comes with full plate, half plate, and splint armor; they can also be purchased separately and worn with other types of armor. They not only protect your hands but also transform your hands into lethal weapons.

weapon->Halfling Sling Staff.name: Halfling Sling Staff
weapon->Halfling Sling Staff.description: This staff ends in a Y-shaped split that cradles a sling. The length of the staff provides excellent leverage when used two-handed to fling rocks or bullets from the sling.

consumable->Explosive Ammunition (Greate.name: Explosive Ammunition (Greater)
consumable->Explosive Ammunition (Greate.description:
Activate A Interact

This piece of ammunition is coated in gritty black soot. When activated explosive ammunition hits a target, the missile explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10], dealing [[/r10d6]] fire damage to each creature in the area (including the target). Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:30|basic:true|name:Greater Explosive Ammunition] save.

consumable->Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
consumable->Sling Bullets.description: These are small metal balls, typically either iron or lead, designed to be used as ammunition in slings.

action->+3 status to all saves vs. evoca.name: +3 status to all saves vs. evocation

action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).name: Attack of Opportunity (Special)
action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
When a creature triggers Ran-to's Attack of Opportunity, he can attempt an Athletics check to Grapple the triggering creature instead of making a melee Strike. He can still disrupt a triggering manipulate action if he critically succeeds his attempt.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Body Slam.name: Body Slam
action->Body Slam.description:
Requirements Ran-to is grabbing a creature

Effect Ran-to throws his foe against the ground. The grabbed creature takes @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:43|basic:true] save) and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. The creature is no longer grabbed.

action->Major Leaping Catch.name: Major Leaping Catch
action->Major Leaping Catch.description: Ran-to leaps from the ground and attempts to grab a foe while he soars. He makes a Leap, High Jump, or Long Jump. His maximum distance is 100 feet. He must succeed at an Athletics check to perform the leap as usual, but regardless of the type of leap the DC is equal to half the number of feet he moves in the air. Ran-to can attempt an Athletics check to Grapple at any point during the jump. Immediately after the attempt, he (and the creature, if the Grapple was successful) falls to the ground. Ran-to takes no falling damage when using this ability, but the grabbed creature takes the appropriate amount of falling damage as if it had fallen the distance moved. Ran-to can spend three actions to use this ability instead of two; if he does, he can use Plummeting Fall to add @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage to the falling damage dealt to the grabbed creature, and the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

action->Plummeting Fall.name: Plummeting Fall
action->Plummeting Fall.description:
(certain kill)

Frequency once per round

Requirements Ran-to has a creature grabbed and the creature is airborne

Effect Ran-to spins and increases the force of gravity, sending him and the creature to the ground. The target takes @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage from the fall and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}; Ran-to is unharmed.

action->Titan Wrestler.name: Titan Wrestler
action->Titan Wrestler.description: Ran-to can attempt to Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip creatures up to two sizes larger than him.

action->Whirlwind Toss.name: Whirlwind Toss
action->Whirlwind Toss.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements Ran-to has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}

Effect Ran-to spins the creature he's holding, smashing it against any creatures within his reach, then throws the creature aside. Ran-to attempts an @Check[type:athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the grabbed creature's Fortitude DC. Regardless of the result, the creature is no longer grabbed after this activity.

Critical Success Ran-to tosses his foe mightily. The grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 20 feet, takes @Damage[16d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. All creatures adjacent to Ran-to take the same amount of bludgeoning damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true] save).

Success As critical success, except the grabbed creature is thrown into a space within 10 feet, and creatures take @Damage[12d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Failure Ran-to tosses his foe aside. The grabbed creature falls prone.

Critical Failure Ran-to loses hold of his foe.

weapon->+3 Greater Striking Erhu Bow.name: +3 Greater Striking Erhu Bow
weapon->+3 Greater Striking Erhu Bow.description: Razu wields his instrument's unique rune- enchanted bow as a deadly weapon. His decades of training with the item allow him to augment it with his own battle cries so that it also deals sonic damage. By attaching the bow's case to its end, he can change the weapon's damage to piercing and use the bow much like a short spear. Any other creature who wields the erhu bow does not deal sonic damage with it, but the weapon otherwise possesses the traits listed above. If sold without its runes, the bow is worth 50 gp.

equipment->Greater Maestro's Instrument.name: Greater Maestro's Instrument (Erhu)
equipment->Greater Maestro's Instrument.description:
A maestro's instrument can be crafted in the form of any variety of handheld musical instrument. A greater maestro's instrument grants you a +3 item bonus to Performance checks while playing music with the instrument.

Activate D Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You can play the instrument to produce the effects of an 8th level (DC 38) @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell.

Craft Requirements You must supply a casting of charm of the appropriate rank.

action->Bow Basher.name: Bow Basher
action->Bow Basher.description: Razu wields his instrument's unique rune- enchanted bow as a deadly weapon. His decades of training with the item allow him to augment it with his own battle cries so that it also deals sonic damage. By attaching the bow's case to its end, he can change the weapon's damage to piercing and use the bow much like a short spear. Any other creature who wields the erhu bow does not deal sonic damage with it, but the weapon otherwise possesses the traits listed above. If sold without its runes, the bow is worth 50 gp.

action->Incredible Volume.name: Incredible Volume
action->Incredible Volume.description: Razu's auditory effects that normally have a range 60 feet or less or an emanation area with a radius of 60 feet or less instead have a range or radius of 300 feet. His auditory effects that normally have a range of greater than 60 feet or an emanation area with a radius of greater than 60 feet instead have a range or radius of 1,200 feet (unless it was already farther). His performances are audible up to 10 miles away.

Rivka (Cimurlian).name: Rivka (Cimurlian)
Rivka (Cimurlian).publicNotes:
Rivkas are parasitic monsters that cling to the sides of kaiju. In their natural form, they resemble giant cockroaches with eight razor-like legs and two mouths-one between two vicious pincers plus a second, much larger mouth on their abdomen. With this secondary mouth they feed off the primordial energy of whichever kaiju they've latched onto.

In the wake of a kaiju attack, a rivka detaches from its host and wades into the disaster zone to prey on the unsuspecting populace by presenting itself as an emissary of the kaiju and demanding tribute. According to this cruel charlatan, only sacrifices of blood and gold can appease their master-though of course the rivka absconds with these offerings before the gifts ever reach the kaiju (such tributes would mean little to the kaiju anyway). Particularly heinous rivkas search the rubble for dead victims to impersonate, magically adopting the visage of a beloved city elder or priest in order to stoke the citizens' paranoia.

Drinking kaiju blood has a strange effect on a rivka's anatomy, enriching both its defensive and offensive capabilities with the primal energy of its host. Other creatures have attempted to drink kaiju blood and replicate this phenomenon, always to terrible effect. Clearly rivkas have coevolved with kaiju in order to metabolize their ancient blood.

action->Kaiju Blood.name: Kaiju Blood
action->Kaiju Blood.description: Each rivka gains resistances and offensive powers by feasting on the primordial blood of a kaiju. The type of damage the rivka resists and the type of damage dealt by its Kaiju Ray depend on the kaiju it last fed upon. Some of the most typical rivkas include those that feed on Cimurlian (cold), Kujiba (negative), Igroon (acid), Mogaru (fire), or Yorak (electricity).

action->Eviscerate.name: Eviscerate
action->Eviscerate.description:
Requirements The rivka has not attacked yet this turn

Effect The rivka lashes out with four of its razor-like claws. It makes four Strikes: the first at its highest attack bonus, the next two with a -4 penalty to their attack rolls, and the last one with a -8 penalty. This ability counts as four Strikes for the purpose of its multiple attack penalty.

action->Kaiju Ray.name: Kaiju Ray
action->Kaiju Ray.description: The rivka opens its maw and projects a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of primal energy that deals @Damage[14d6[cold]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true|traits:cold] save). The type of damage dealt by the ray depends on which kaiju the rivka has most recently fed from (see above). The rivka can't use Kaiju Ray again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Kaiju Ray]]{1d4 rounds}.
